header.title: CI/CD & DevOps
header.description: Build reliable delivery pipelines, automate release workflows, and define deployment governance.

foundations.title: CI/CD Foundations
foundations.description: Automation is only useful when it improves feedback loops and lowers risk of production incidents.

pillars.title: Repeatability
pillars.desc: Every commit should generate the same result when run with the same inputs.

pillars.title: Visibility
pillars.desc: Every stage should output clear logs, artifacts, and status signals.

pillars.title: Guardrails
pillars.desc: Failures should fail fast with rollback paths and explicit quality gates.

pillars.title: Consistency
pillars.desc: Local, CI, and production environments should behave similarly.

process: Developer pushes commit to a tracked branch.
CI runs formatting, lint, tests, and build.
Quality checks block merging when any step fails.
Approved artifacts are promoted to release environments.
foundations.demoText: Think in stages, not tools. Measure where bugs escape and place checks before that boundary.
foundations.finalNote: CI and CD are delivery systems. Keep humans in control where automation decisions can impact production.

githubActions.title: GitHub Actions Workflow
githubActions.description: A practical foundation for orchestrating lint, test, build, and security checks.

triggers.label: Main branch push
triggers.detail: Run full checks on push to main and release branches.

triggers.label: Pull request
triggers.detail: Validate before merge by running required job list.

triggers.label: Schedule
triggers.detail: Nightly dependency and security checks for drift detection.

triggers.label: Manual dispatch
triggers.detail: Emergency run with explicit environment selection.

githubActions.workflowYaml:
name: CI
on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      environment:
        description: 'deploy environment'
        required: true
        type: choice
        default: staging
        options:
          - staging
          - production

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: 20
      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm run lint
security: Use cache keyed by lockfile to reduce pipeline time.
Use OIDC and secret scanning for deploy credentials.
Upload code coverage and store artifacts for post-mortem analysis.
githubActions.note: Keep reusable workflows in one file and expose only necessary inputs through strict interfaces.

ciPipeline.title: CI Pipeline Design
ciPipeline.description: Split checks into independent jobs with explicit dependencies and parallel opportunities.

stages.name: Validation
stages.detail: Lint, formatting, type checks, and unit tests.

stages.name: Quality
stages.detail: Integration tests, E2E smoke checks, and coverage.

stages.name: Packaging
stages.detail: Build artifacts, cache them, and attach version metadata.

strategies.title: Monolithic jobs
strategies.detail: Simple but can waste time when a single failure blocks everything.

strategies.title: Matrix jobs
strategies.detail: Good for Node/OS versions and environment combinations.

strategies.title: Reusable jobs
strategies.detail: Consistent behavior across multiple repositories or projects.

ciPipeline.matrixYaml:
strategy:
  fail-fast: false
  matrix:
    node-version: [18, 20, 22]
    os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]

steps:
  - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    with:
      node-version: MATRIX_NODE_VERSION
  - run: npm test
ciPipeline.warning: Avoid duplicating expensive jobs across branches; extract cache and lockfile validation into shared templates.

cdPipeline.title: CD: Release Strategy
cdPipeline.description: Move from staging confidence to controlled production rollout.

modes.title: Continuous Delivery
modes.detail: Human approval step before production release.

modes.title: Continuous Deployment
modes.detail: Auto release after predefined checks pass.

rollout: Run smoke tests against staging after every release.
Track deployment status and auto-alert on health checks.
Freeze releases if error budgets are violated.
cdPipeline.workflowText: Build → staging smoke → manual or auto approval → production canary → full production.
cdPipeline.note: Treat environment promotion as an approval surface; never ship to production by accident.

docker.title: Docker Deployment
docker.description: Use multi-stage builds and immutable artifacts for predictable runtime images.
steps: Create deterministic dependencies with lockfile install.
Build production assets in an isolated build stage.
Use a small runtime image and minimal runtime permissions.
Copy built artifacts and cache static assets in nginx layer.
docker.dockerfile:
FROM node:20-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY package.json pnpm-lock.yaml ./
RUN corepack enable && corepack prepare pnpm@latest --activate
RUN pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
COPY . .
RUN pnpm build

FROM nginx:alpine AS runner
COPY nginx.conf /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
COPY --from=builder /app/dist /usr/share/nginx/html
EXPOSE 80
CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]
docker.compose:
version: "3.8"

services:
  web:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    ports:
      - "3000:80"
    restart: unless-stopped
docker.note: Pin image tags, scan every image for vulnerabilities, and keep secrets out of Dockerfiles.

governance.title: DevOps Governance
governance.description: Governance prevents pipelines from becoming brittle and insecure.
checklist: Branch and environment approval policy documented.
Clear rollback process with owner ownership.
security: Store credentials in GitHub Actions secrets, never inline.
Use `permissions` and least privilege for tokens.
Use dependency audit and Snyk/OSS scans on schedule.
governance.note: Rotate secrets before they enter the deployment flow and make every environment auditable.

capstone.title: Mini Capstone
capstone.description: Wire all topics together into one production-like workflow.

outcomes.title: Define your pipeline
outcomes.detail: Create CI triggers, status checks, and artifact naming.

outcomes.title: Write robust jobs
outcomes.detail: Add lint/test/typecheck/build jobs with clear dependencies.

outcomes.title: Add security checks
outcomes.detail: Attach audit, secret-scan, and coverage jobs.

outcomes.title: Create CD path
outcomes.detail: Deploy to staging with manual/stable gate and smoke checks.

outcomes.title: Containerize
outcomes.detail: Add Dockerfile + compose and run image scan.

outcomes.title: Automate repeatability
outcomes.detail: Store pipeline templates and add reusable workflows.

outcomes.title: Post-release review
outcomes.detail: Collect metrics and document incidents, rollback, and fixes.

capstone.planYaml:
name: Release
on:
  push:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  build:
    uses: ./.github/workflows/build.yml
  deploy:
    needs: build
    uses: ./.github/workflows/deploy.yml
    with:
      environment: production
capstone.finalTip: Verify monitoring, rollback paths, and incident ownership before merging the final release commit.
